name: Fake Simplify GST rates to two rates Fake

not_started.description: There are currently five rates under the Goods and Services Tax

incomplete.description:
* Reduced to 4 rates
* Reduced to 3 rates

name: Fake Allow more than 50% foreign investment in insurance

not_started.description: Only 49% foreign investment is currently allowed, with minority ownership for the foreign firm

incomplete.description: If amendments to Insurance Act are passed by Parliament that more than 50%, but minority ownership regulations are not lifted

completed.description: Amendments to Insurance Act passed by Parliament allowing majority foreign ownership without management and control restrictions

name: Fake Institute a Mandatory 30-day "Notice and Comment" period for proposed regulations

not_started.description: Regulations are implemented without a 30-day notice and comment period

incomplete.description: Ministry of Law and Justice or Cabinet issues note calling on government agencies to honor a 30-day notification period

completed.description: Parliament passes statutes amending the laws governing India’s financial regulators, mandating a 30-day notice and comment period for proposed regulation

name: Fake Create a bankruptcy resolution process for financial firms

not_started.description: Financial institutions have been kept out of the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code's purview

incomplete.description: 5/20/2019: A financial resolution bill is approved by Parliament, but underlying regulations are not issued or contain critical weaknesses

completed.description: 5/5/2020: The law is passed in Parliament and signed into law by the President of India, and related regulations are issued5

not_started.description: The Reserve Bank of India currently forces bank to allocate 40% of their credit to priority sectors

incomplete.description: 5/15/2020: The RBI reduces the stipulation to below 40%, but stops short of abolishing the practice entirely, or allows more flexibility in the discharge of these obligations

completed.description: The RBI removes its stipulation that banks should allocate a certain percentage to priority sectors.

name: Fake Stop forcing banks to lend to "priority sectors"
